subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|おと}}
Cognate with the verb {{m|ja|劣る|tr=otoru||to be lesser, inferior}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Brother}} [[File:Nuclear_family_member_younger_brother.svg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|弟}} (''otōto''): the orange highlighting indicates the '''[[younger]] [[brother]]''' relative to all of the children to the left.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|おとうと}} {{IPAchar|/otopito/}} → {{IPAchar|/otoɸito/}} → {{IPAchar|/otowito/}} → {{IPAchar|/*otowuto/}} → {{IPAchar|/otouto/}} → {{IPAchar|/otoːto/}} Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=おとうと|弟|t1=younger sibling|tr1=oto|人|t2=person|tr2=hito}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Used when referring to one’s own younger brother. To refer to someone else’s younger brother, the suffixed form {{m|ja|弟}}{{m|ja|さん|tr=otōto-san}} is used instead. When ''addressing'' one’s own younger brother, the given name is used, often with a suffix, such as {{m|ja|太郎}}{{m|ja|君|tr=Tarō-kun}}. Contrast with addressing one’s own older brother, when one uses the honorific {{m|ja|お兄さん|tr=onīsan}}.
